what: Functions and utilities to export hiplot output — export
title: Functions and utilities to export hiplot output — export
text: Functions utilities export hiplot output

title: Functions and utilities to export hiplot output — export
code: export_single(x)  export_pptx(x, outfn, width, height)  export_plotly(x, outfn)  export_directory(   outdir = "output",   pdf_tb_subdir = c("output", "output/results"),   recursive = c(FALSE, TRUE),   sheetname_replace = "_BayesianNMF|legacy_fitting_|_fitting|.csv" )  export_htmlwidget(x)  html2pdf(inhtml, outpdf)  pdf2image(pdf, i = "")  pdfs2image(pdfs)  merge_pdfs(pdfs, outpdf)  split_pdfs(pdfs, outdir)  import_images_to_pdf(pdfs)  read_data(path, format = c("csv", "excel", "rds", "rdata"), header = TRUE, ...)  parse_file_link(link)

title: Functions and utilities to export hiplot output — export
text: x plot object export. outfn output file path. width width output pptx. height height output pptx. outdir output directory. pdf_tb_subdir directory path storing pdf (figure) files. recursive path pdf_tb_subdir specify run recursive mode. sheetname_replace .csv files re-exported excel file, necessary, use option remove string sheet names. inhtml input html file. outpdf output pdf file. pdf input pdf file. postfix added output file name. pdfs input pdf files. path file path data. format import data format. header TRUE, tread input header. ... parameters passing data.table::fread use function import inside. link file link

title: Functions and utilities to export hiplot output — export
text: export_single: Export single ggplot object export_pptx: Export single ggplot object PPTx export_plotly: Export single ggplot object plotly export_directory: Export hiplot plugin output directory zipped file export_htmlwidget: Export single ggplot object html file html2pdf: Convert html pdf pdf2image: Convert pdf images pdfs2image: Convert multiple pdfs images merge_pdfs: Merge multiple pdf files one split_pdfs: Split multiple page pdfs directory import_images_to_pdf: Export non-pdf images pdfs read_data: Read common format data data frame parse_file_link: Parse true file path link

title: Functions and utilities to export hiplot output — export

title: Prestored settings and functions related to ggplot2 or plots — ggplot2
code: cb_palette  ggsci_palette_names  ggsci_palette_length  brewer_palette_names  prism_palette_names  graf_palette_names  ggplot2_themes  ggplot2_themes2  choose_ggplot_theme(p, theme = "theme_bw")  return_ggplot_theme(theme = "theme_bw")  position_type(label = c("dodge", "fill", "stack"))  set_palette_theme(p, conf = globs_get("conf"))  set_complex_general_theme(p, conf = globs_get("conf"))  return_hiplot_palette(u, custom = NULL)  return_hiplot_palette_color(u, custom = NULL)  get_hiplot_color(u, n = -1, custom = NULL)  gg_color_default(n)  brewer_pal_update(n, panel = "Set3")  transparentColor(col, alpha = 200)  custom_color_filter(cols)  alter_fun(x, y, w, h, v)  col_fun_cont(   x,   cols = c("#196ABD", "#3399FF", "#3399FF", "#f4f4f4", "#f4f4f4", "#f4f4f4", "#FF3333",     "#FF3333", "#C20B01") )  col_tag  mut_cols  draw_map(rds, keyname, filter_names = NULL)

title: Prestored settings and functions related to ggplot2 or plots — ggplot2
text: object class character length 37. object class character length 16. object class numeric length 16. object class character length 9. object class character length 65. object class character length 3. object class character length 50. object class list length 6. object class character length 2. object class character length 30.

title: Prestored settings and functions related to ggplot2 or plots — ggplot2
text: p ggplot object. theme string specifying theme. label position label, one 'dodge', 'fill' 'stack'. conf conf object, see conf. u one predefined palette name. See ggsci_palette_names, brewer_palette_names, prism_palette_names, etc. custom user specified custom color vector. n number colors. panel defines color panel want col color. alpha alpha value. cols colors. x, y, w, h, v set parameters passing grid::grid.rect. rds file storing format .RDS. keyname keyname plot. filter_names used filtering.

title: Prestored settings and functions related to ggplot2 or plots — ggplot2
text: cb_palette: vector colors ggsci_palette_names: vector ggsci palette names ggsci_palette_length: Maximum color number provided palette ggsci_palette_names brewer_palette_names: vector RColorBrewer palette names prism_palette_names: vector prism palette names graf_palette_names: vector graf palette names ggplot2_themes: vector ggplot2 themes ggplot2_themes2: list ggplot2 themes choose_ggplot_theme: Set ggplot2 theme ggplot object return_ggplot_theme: Return ggplot2 theme based string position_type: Return position type set_palette_theme: Set palette theme conf ggplot object set_complex_general_theme: Set complex general theme conf ggplot object return_hiplot_palette: Return ggplot2 scale fill palette predefined custom colors return_hiplot_palette_color: Return ggplot2 scale color palette predefined custom colors, similar return_hiplot_palette get_hiplot_color: Get colors color palette gg_color_default: color generator default colors ggplot brewer_pal_update: update version brew.pal function transparentColor: Transparent colors custom_color_filter: custom color filter alter_fun: alter_fun used ComplexHeatmap col_fun_cont: color function used ComplexHeatmap col_tag: col_tag used ComplexHeatmap (TODO: make sure) mut_cols: mapping mutation type colors used ComplexHeatmap (TODO: make sure) draw_map: Draw Map

title: Prestored settings and functions related to ggplot2 or plots — ggplot2

text: x name global object, common used "conf". name x valid global object name, specify name. recommended.

title: Functions to manage the global setting objects — globs
text: globs_list: list available global objects globs_get: get data specified global objects globs_set: reassign specified data (name) available global object

title: Functions to manage the global setting objects — globs
code: if (FALSE) { conf <- globs_get("conf") # Modify conf # xxx # Then reassign globs_set("conf") }

what: Get the same characters in two strings — list_same_string_position
title: Get the same characters in two strings — list_same_string_position
text: Get characters two strings

title: Get the same characters in two strings — list_same_string_position
code: list_same_string_position(   a,   b,   exclude = c("-", "?"),   ignore_case = TRUE,   show_excluded = FALSE,   only_position = TRUE )

title: Get the same characters in two strings — list_same_string_position
text: , b string. exclude symbol exclude comparison. ignore_case TRUE, ignore case. show_excluded TRUE, show excluded. only_position TRUE, position vector returned.

title: Get the same characters in two strings — list_same_string_position
code: list_same_string_position("abcde", "fbcde") #> [1] 2 3 4 5 list_same_string_position("abcde", "fbcde", only_position = FALSE) #>   position seq.a seq.b #> 1        2     B     B #> 2        3     C     C #> 3        4     D     D #> 4        5     E     E

title: Set a vector to a factor — set_factors
code: set_factors(c("B", "B", "A", "C")) #> [1] B B A C #> Levels: B A C set_factors(c("B", "B", "A", "C"), rev = TRUE) #> [1] B B A C #> Levels: C A B set_factors(c("B", "B", "A", "C"), sort = TRUE) #> [1] B B A C #> Levels: A B C
